conversion_info.description: Information about the conversion process to FAIR format.

operating_system_esp.description: Indicates file origin (DOS/Windows vs Unix) affecting endianness (ESP).

total_points_esp.description: Total number of data points in the file (ESP). Useful for consistency check.

status_flags_esp.description: Job and Spectrometer Status flags (bit-encoded) (ESP). Indicates complex, 2D, etc.

scanned_size_x_esp.description: Number of points acquired along X dimension (ESP, often pulse).

scanned_size_y_esp.description: Number of points acquired along Y dimension (ESP, often pulse).

pulse_axis_x_start_esp.description: Start value for X axis in pulse experiments (ESP).

pulse_axis_x_width_esp.description: Width/range for X axis in pulse experiments (ESP).

pulse_axis_y_start_esp.description: Start value for Y axis in 2D pulse experiments (ESP).

pulse_axis_y_width_esp.description: Width/range for Y axis in 2D pulse experiments (ESP).

pulse_axis_x_unit_esp.description: Unit for X axis in pulse experiments (ESP).

pulse_axis_y_unit_esp.description: Unit for Y axis in pulse experiments (ESP).

experiment_type_esp.description: Primary experiment type declared in ESP (e.g., 'field-sweep', 'ENDOR', 'time-sweep').

experiment_axis_y_esp.description: Parameter varied along the Y-axis in ESP (e.g., 'frequency-sweep', 'mw-power-sweep').

resolution_x_esp.description: Number of points along the X axis (older ESP name).

resolution_y_esp.description: Number of points along the Y axis (older ESP name).

field_center.description: Center magnetic field for the sweep (ESP).

field_sweep_width.description: Magnetic field sweep width (ESP). Total range = HSW.

receiver_gain_counts.description: Receiver gain setting (ESP, often linear arbitrary counts).

microwave_power_at_sample.description: Microwave power *estimated* at the sample (ESP/WinEPR). Often calculated based on bridge attenuation and source power. Calibration is usually required for accuracy.
